9: Many people find that exercising outdoors has a positive impact on both their physical health and mental well-being.

(2) People often find that outdoor exercise improves both physical health and mental well-being.
(3) Many people enjoy exercising outdoors because it positively affects both their physical health and mental well-being.
(4) The positive effects of outdoor exercise on physical health and mental well-being are widely acknowledged.
10: In the digital age, social media platforms have become powerful tools for connecting people across the globe, though they also come with certain risks such as privacy concerns and misinformation.
(1) Social media platforms connect people globally, but they also raise important issues such as privacy concerns and misinformation.
(2) While social media platforms help connect people worldwide, they can also create risks, including privacy issues and misinformation.
(3) Despite the global connectivity offered by social media, these platforms come with serious risks related to privacy and misinformation.
(4) Social media platforms, though useful for global connections, can contribute to risks like privacy concerns and misinformation.
11: The rapid advancement of technology has fundamentally altered the way we work, live, and communicate, creating both opportunities and challenges for society.
(1) Technology's rapid progress has reshaped work, life, and communication, presenting both opportunities and challenges for society.
(2) The fast pace of technological advancement has drastically changed the way we live, work, and communicate, bringing both benefits and difficulties.
(3) With the rapid development of technology, society faces both new opportunities and challenges in work, life, and communication.
(4) The profound changes in how we work, live, and communicate, driven by technology, come with both advantages and obstacles.
12: Climate change, fueled by human activity, presents one of the most significant challenges of our time, requiring urgent action to mitigate its effects on the environment, economy, and society.
(1) Human activity has caused climate change, which now poses a serious challenge requiring immediate action to protect the environment, economy, and society.
(2) Climate change, driven by human activity, is a critical challenge that requires urgent efforts to minimize its impact on the environment, economy, and society.
(3) The most pressing issue of our time is climate change, caused by human activity, which demands swift action to reduce its negative effects on all aspects of life.
(4) Climate change, resulting from human actions, is one of the most urgent global challenges, with far-reaching consequences for the environment, economy, and society.
